channel.title: Comments on: From the George Mann Archives: Lost gems of the Sunset Strip

item.title: By: Jonathan Weiss
item.dc:creator: Jonathan Weiss
item.description: Jack's was owned by <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jack_D._Crouch" rel="nofollow ugc">Jack D. Crouch - Wikipedia</a>.
item.content:encoded: Jack’s was owned by Jack D. Crouch – Wikipedia.

item.title: By: Kim Cooper
item.dc:creator: Kim Cooper
item.description: What an interesting find! That half-rounded building shows its origins as a Simon's Drive-In. I'm not good at dating cars, which might help in figuring out when this image was shot, but I believe the waitress neon shot by George Mann was on a much taller pole. So maybe both signs existed at the same time--but given the choice, who wouldn't shoot the waitress?
item.content:encoded: What an interesting find! That half-rounded building shows its origins as a Simon’s Drive-In. I’m not good at dating cars, which might help in figuring out when this image was shot, but I believe the waitress neon shot by George Mann was on a much taller pole. So maybe both signs existed at the same time–but given the choice, who wouldn’t shoot the waitress?

item.title: By: Martin Pal
item.dc:creator: Martin Pal
item.description:
I have a question about the Jack's Hamburger sign...I found a photo of Jack's place on Sunset Blvd. and the neon sign out front isn't like the one you have posted for the location. Wondering if the sign was changed or from a different place? Here's the link:
https://media.gettyimages.com/photos/photo-of-hollywood-and-sunset-boulevard-and-50s-style-and-sunset-picture-id86238100
item.content:encoded:
I have a question about the Jack’s Hamburger sign…I found a photo of Jack’s place on Sunset Blvd. and the neon sign out front isn’t like the one you have posted for the location. Wondering if the sign was changed or from a different place? Here’s the link:
